channel.title: Windows can not detect a Internet adapter/driver
channel.description:
I can't connect to the Internet on my Windows 7 Home premium laptop Pavilion g7-1219wm NoteBook PC
I am typing this from my desktop, obviously not my laptop.. >.> I have bought a flash-drive and was wondering what I could do to reinstall this driver.. Can I put this on the Flash-Drive? And what driver do I download?
How did this problem occur? LOL, My computer was running slow, so I decided to give it a GOOD clean, I knew format had meant clear completely, But I thought windows would keep the files needed.. And I formatted Windows Tools, and System Recovery.. Lol, Just then my computer shut off and I had to re-download windows... How could I get the correct drivers on my laptop now?

item.title: Windows can not detect a Internet adapter/driver
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

http://h10025.www1.hp.com/ewfrf/wc/softwareCategory?product=5158898&lc=en&cc=us&dlc=en&lang=en&cc=us

Read full topic

item.source: Windows can not detect a Internet adapter/driver

item.title: Windows can not detect a Internet adapter/driver
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

I can help :3
download http://www.devicedoctor.com/ and run it. This will scan your computer for drivers that are outdated or missing. you can then save the outcome of the scan on the usb, put the usb in the desktop and open the scan. Click the driver downloads for the the WLAN and LAN. Once you download the drivers stick em in the USB then put them on the laptop. Problem solved :3 no need to thank me

Read full topic
